value.title: DAX Fridays! #121: Avoid bidirectional relationships (brute force method)
value.excerpt: In this video, I am going to show you a trick on how to create power bi models like a pro, even when you are a beginner and do not understand modeling very well yet.  You still have to learn how to model in power bi, but this will get you far until you are there. Happy Friday!  Link to why you should

value.title: DAX Fridays! #166: Compare spread after the first 100 cases | Recreating the Financial Times Graph
value.excerpt: In todays video I will show you how to recreate the financial times graph in power bi where they compare the spread of confirmed cases after the countries hit their first 100 cases.  We will do the calculation using DAX and will plot the graph in Power BI.  Link to FT article: https://www.ft.com/content/a26fbf7e-48f8-11ea-aeb3-955839e06441

value.title: DAX Fridays! #197: Why you need to test your DAX measures in different contexts
value.excerpt: Always, always, always test your DAX measures in different contexts (different filtering scenarios) to make sure your DAX measure is calculating correctly.
